Comment: First of all, according to our Founding Fathers' Constitution we are supposed to be a secular country not run by any particular religion. This said, I completely understand your point that you brought up. Back when my maternal grandmother was alive we were very much a "churchgoing" family but that largely ceased to be the case after she passed away (though my mom and I still have our beliefs, my sister became an atheist at some point later on down the line if that's either here or there). It will forever boggle my mind how anyone could ever possibly reconcile being a Christian who worships the Jesus of the Bible with being one of the MAGATS. In the Bible Jesus preached about healing the sick and feeding the hungry and welcoming the immigrants and defending the marginalized and not being judgmental. Jesus was apolitical for His times but frankly if He were somehow resurrected in the twenty-first century USA He would at best be slammed for being woke!
